summary: Completed comprehensive testing of CicloStudy Pomodoro app after environment variable fix. Backend APIs are 100% functional. Most frontend features work correctly including authentication, subject management, shop, quests, and statistics. Critical issue: Pomodoro timer (core feature) not displaying when study sessions are started.

resolved_issues.details: 16/16 API tests passed including auth, subjects, study sessions, shop, stats, quests, settings

critical_bugs.issue: Timer interface does not appear when clicking 'Estudar' button on subjects
critical_bugs.impact: Core Pomodoro functionality completely broken - users cannot start study sessions
critical_bugs.details: Study session start API call may be failing or timer state management has issues

integration_issues.issue: Study button click does not trigger timer display

resolved_issues.fix: Added fallback URL for REACT_APP_BACKEND_URL in Dashboard.js and Landing.js

passed_tests: Backend API authentication and session management
Subject creation with name, color, and time goal
Subject display in dashboard with progress tracking
Statistics tab loading and data display
Shop tab with 30 items (Selos, Bordas, Temas)
Quests tab with 4 quests and progress bars
Navigation between tabs (Estudar, Estat√≠sticas, Loja, Quests)
Logout functionality and redirect to landing page
Landing page UI and login button display
action_item_for_main_agent: CRITICAL: Fix Pomodoro timer functionality. The study session start workflow is broken - when users click 'Estudar' button, the timer interface ([data-testid='study-timer']) does not appear. This blocks the core functionality of the app. Possible causes: 1) Study session start API call failing silently, 2) Timer state management issues in React, 3) Conditional rendering logic for timer component. All other features work correctly.

success_percentage.frontend: 80% - Authentication, subjects, shop, quests, stats work. Timer (core feature) broken
